Program Maps¶

Note

In Firefox, you may not be able to view the maps directly because of protection issues with mindmeister cookies. Each Figure has a Footnote with a hyperlink to the original MindMap which you can use.

However, if you wish to watch it on firefox: go to settings –> Privacy & Security –> Change Enhanced Tracking Protection from Standard/Stric to Custom –> Enable everything but in Cookies options select Cross-site tracking cookies instead of Cross-site tracking cookies, and isolate others cross-site cookies.

Note

In Chrome can be the same.

If you want to watch it: go to settings (chrome://settings/) –> search for Cookies in the “Search settings bar” –> go to Cookies and other side data –> Disable Block third-party cookies

There seems to be some instances with problems to display frames with Chrome even with the adjustments made before. If this is the case, try to use Firefox instead

Program Main Map

The next map shows the main relationships between the different functions in the program:

BLASTER - Programming by Francisco Pacheco Hinojosa

If your browser is not able to display frames. Please visit BLASTER - Programming on MindMeister.



Program Main Map with Arguments

The next map will show the same relationships as the one before, but instead of connections between functions, it will make them between its arguments:

BLASTER Arguments by Francisco Pacheco Hinojosa

If your browser is not able to display frames. Please visit BLASTER Arguments on MindMeister.



Program structured inside Modules

At last, this map will show something pretty similar to the first one here. But the functions will be grouped inside their modules, so the relationships between modules can be known:

BLASTER - Modules by Francisco Pacheco Hinojosa

If your browser is not able to display frames. Please visit BLASTER - Modules on MindMeister.
